get.summary: Find accounts in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all accounts whose name contains the word smith, the search expression parameter will be where=name=smith. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned. Only returns details about your account.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

post.summary: Create a new activity in the CRM system. Activity creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the [id] field, the required fields indicated in the activity model are those required to create a new activity. Required fields are the strings, [due_date] and [content].

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The activity object to be created. With the exception of the [id] field, the required fields indicated in the activity model are those required to create a new activity. Required fields are the strings, [due_date] and [content].

get.summary: Find activities in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all activities whose name contains the word the search expression parameter will be where=name=jones. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for activities last modified on or after Jan 15, 2014, the search expression will be where: [lastModifiedDate=2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z]. When this parameter is omitted, all activities are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

patch.summary: Update the activity associated with the given ID in the CRM system. The update API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the activity object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left alone. Updating an activity with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response. Reads as a PUT

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the activity to update in the CRM system.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The activity object, with those fields that are to be updated. Required fields are the strings, [due_date] and [content].

get.summary: Fetch all the bulk jobs for an instance

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The Url to send the notification to when the Job is completed
parameters.name: Elements-Async-Callback-Url

parameters.description: The CEQL query. When this parameter is omitted, all objects of the given type are returned via the bulk job. Endpoint limiters may still apply.
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: The last time this query was run. This is optional. You can also have this parameter in the query and leave this blank - optional eg. '2014-10-06T13:22:17-08:00'
parameters.name: lastRunDate

parameters.description: The created/updated date of the object to filter on - optional eg. '2014-10-06T13:22:17-08:00'
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: The created/updated date of the object to filter on - optional eg. '2014-10-06T13:22:17-08:00'
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: Optional JSON MetaData that contains callback-payload, ex: {"callback-payload" : <Json> }. callback-payload - is passed back in bulk job notification
parameters.name: metaData

get.summary: Retrieve the results of an asynchronous bulk query.

parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The Url to send the notification to when the Job is completed
parameters.name: Elements-Async-Callback-Url

parameters.description: The name of the object for which data needs to be uploaded.
parameters.name: objectName

parameters.description: Optional JSON MetaData that contains callback-payload, path or format, ex: {"path" : <path for the sub resource>, "format": <json/csv>, "callback-payload":<json>}. path - is passed to the endpoint for bulk loading the data into a nested object. Optional JSON Metadata that contains identifierFieldName, action, listId or campaignId. The identifierField name is used for upserts and the optional fields like listId or campaignId. Example: {"listId":"1014","action":"upsert"}. If the Upload format is JSON pass metadata as {"format":"json"}. callback-payload - is passed back in bulk job notification
parameters.name: metaData

parameters.description: The file of objects to bulk load. If the JSON file upload, each JSON record should be in a single line
parameters.name: file

post.summary: Create a new note in the CRM system. Note creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the [id] field, the required fields indicated in the note model are those required to create a new note. Required fields are the strings, [resource_type], [content], and the number, [resource_id].

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The note object to be created. With the exception of the [id] field, the required fields indicated in the note model are those required to create a new note. Required fields are the strings, [resource_type], [content], and the number, [resource_id].

get.summary: Find notes in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all notes whose name contains the word the search expression parameter will be where=name=jones. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for notes last modified on or after Jan 15, 2014, the search expression will be where: [lastModifiedDate=2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z]. When this parameter is omitted, all notes are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied.
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

job_query.x-samplevalue: SELECT attributes.organizationid, attributes.systemuserid, organizationid FROM users WHERE organizationid = '3b80f68d-b945-4208-9442-f55bd0e1c5b2'

summary.x-samplevalue: Create a new contact in the CRM service. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Contact' model are those required to create a new contact.
